function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Incomplete investigation of shelter-in-place variables for COVID-19 spread.","Impact":"Limitation in understanding the full impact of lockdown measures on disease spread.","Mitigation":"Include shelter-in-place variables in future research on COVID-19 spread for a more comprehensive understanding.","Technologies":"Data collection and analysis technologies for shelter-in-place variables.","People":"Researchers, public health officials, policymakers","Owner":"Research institutions, health organizations, government agencies"},{"Description":"Unintuitive associations between the built environment (BE) attributes and infection cases.","Impact":"Difficulty in understanding and mitigating the impact of BE on disease spread.","Mitigation":"Develop analysis approaches that incorporate causalities between dependent and independent variables to better understand associations.","Technologies":"Advanced data analysis and statistical modeling techniques.","People":"Data analysts, researchers, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning agencies"},{"Description":"Need for more spatially fine data to measure the influence of the built environment (BE) attributes on disease spread.","Impact":"Limitation in accurately assessing the impact of BE on disease spread due to lack of detailed spatial data.","Mitigation":"Collect and analyze more spatially fine data to measure the influence of BE attributes on disease spread.","Technologies":"Geospatial data collection and analysis technologies.","People":"Data analysts, researchers, urban planners","Owner":"Research institutions, urban planning agencies"}]}
